abstract.p: Federal authorities report four people pleaded guilty to felony charges of violating laws against unauthorized decryption of satellite programming; seven others are facing charges after 22-month investigation into sale of counterfeit or pirated satellite television access cards (S)

block.p: Federal authorities said yesterday that four people pleaded guilty to felony charges of violating laws against the unauthorized decryption of satellite programming. Seven others are facing charges after a 22-month investigation into the sale of counterfeit and pirated satellite television access cards. The cards, which draw a black-market price of about $325 to $425 each, allow users to obtain satellite TV pictures at no monthly cost.
